name: teleport
description: Teleport is a self-hosted secure access platform for SSH, Kubernetes, databases, and web apps. It centralizes identity-based access, auditing, and session recording with CLI tooling, web UI, and APIs, and is also available as a cloud service.
features: Unified access: Provide single sign-on access to SSH servers, Kubernetes clusters, databases, and web applications.
Identity-based access: Authenticate users with SSO providers like Okta, GitHub, or SAML for centralized identity management.
Session recording: Record all SSH and Kubernetes sessions for compliance, auditing, and security review.
Certificate-based auth: Use short-lived certificates instead of static credentials for improved security posture.
Access requests: Implement approval workflows for privileged access with just-in-time permission elevation.
Web UI: Access infrastructure resources through a browser-based interface without installing client tools.
CLI tools: Use command-line tools for SSH, database, and Kubernetes access with seamless authentication.
Audit logging: Maintain comprehensive audit logs of all access events and administrative actions.
Role-based access: Define granular roles and permissions to control who can access which resources.
Database access: Connect to databases securely with automatic credential rotation and session monitoring.
Kubernetes access: Access Kubernetes clusters with identity-aware authentication and RBAC integration.
Cloud or self-hosted: Deploy on your infrastructure or use the managed cloud service for simplified operations.
